title: Cattle at Rest on a Hillside in the Alps

thumbnail.alt_text: Painting of black and tan cattle lying on short, green grass with a cloudy mountain top view behind them.

publication_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, Catalogue of Paintings, Sculpture, and Other Objects in the Museum (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 1894), p. 61, no. 110.

Art Institute of Chicago, Catalogue of Objects in the Museum (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 1895), p. 73, no. 110. 

Art Institute of Chicago, Catalogue of Objects in the Museum (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 1896), p. 80, no. 110.

Art Institute of Chicago, Catalogue of Objects in the Museum (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 1898), p. 101, no. 110. 

Charles Francis Browne, “The Permanent Collections in the Museum of the Art Institute of Chicago. VII – The Munger Collection,” 3, 1 (1898), pp. 10, 13 (ill.). 

“Chicago, ILL.: The Art Institute of Chicago,” in American Art Annual 1898 (London: Macmillan & Co., 1899), p. 143, 110.

“Rosa Bonheur is Dead,” Chicago Daily Tribune (May 27, 1899), p. 3. 

Art Institute of Chicago, General Catalogue of Objects in the Museum (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 1901), pp. 171, no. 179.

René Reyrol, “The Art of Rosa Bonheur, or Rosa Bonheur: Her Life and Work,” Masters in Art 4, 44 (1903), p. 42.

Art Institute of Chicago, General Catalogue of Objects in the Museum (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 1904), p. 177, no. 179.

Art Institute of Chicago, General Catalogue of Sculpture, Paintings, and Other Objects (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 1907), p. 189, no. 179.

Art Institute of Chicago, Paintings in the Art Institute of Chicago: A Catalogue of the Picture Collection (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 1961), p. 27.

Rosalia Shriver, Rosa Bonheur: With a Checklist of Works in American Collections (Philadelphia: The Arts Alliance Press, 1982), pp. 53, 66 (ill.).

McIntosh, and Alison McQueen, Collecting in the Gilded Aged: Art Patronage in Pittsburgh, 1890–1910, exh. cat. (Pittsburgh: Frick Art & Historical Center, 1997), p. 325.
provenance_text: Albert A. Munger (died 1898), Chicago; on loan to the Art Institute from at least 1894 [see Art Institute of Chicago 1894]; bequeathed to the Art Institute, 1901; lent to Logan Museum of Anthropology, Beloit College on long-term loan, 1922–1950.

input: Cattle at Rest on a Hillside in the Alps
